revised_title: Chemical Analysis of Burmese Naphtha and Its Components
tldr: The authors examine Burmese naphtha, also known as Rangoon tar, and analyze its volatile and solid constituents. They use distillation and chemical reactions to separate and identify various hydrocarbons, including benzol, toluol, xylol, and cumol. The study provides insight into the composition of this natural product and its potential applications.
